response_requirements.initial_response_description: Agency must grant access, deny access, or acknowledge receipt and provide approximate date when request will be granted or denied
response_requirements.final_response_notes: If acknowledged, agency has additional 20 business days to respond (total maximum 25 business days)
response_requirements.extension_notes: After initial 5 business day acknowledgment, agency has up to 20 additional business days for reasonable circumstances

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: Agencies may not charge for staff time to locate and retrieve records
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: $0.25 per page for documents up to 9"x14"; actual cost for larger or special formats
fee_structure.electronic_fee: No charge for records provided electronically

exemptions.description: Records specifically exempted from disclosure by state or federal statute
Records compiled for law enforcement purposes that would interfere with investigations, deprive fair trial, identify confidential sources, reveal investigative techniques, or endanger life or safety
Records that would constitute unwarranted invasion of personal privacy
Trade secrets or confidential commercial information
Inter-agency or intra-agency materials that are not statistical or factual tabulations, instructions to staff that affect the public, or final agency policy
Computer access codes and security records that could endanger life or safety or jeopardize security
Records that could endanger life or safety of correctional facility personnel or inmates, or jeopardize security

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Administrative appeal must be filed within 30 days of denial
appeal_process.second_level: Committee on Open Government or Court
appeal_process.second_level_notes: If administrative appeal denied, requestor may seek guidance from Committee on Open Government or file Article 78 proceeding in court
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award reasonable attorney fees and litigation costs if requestor substantially prevails

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Agency may not require requestor to provide identification or state purpose for request
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Must reasonably describe records; electronic submission required if agency has email capability
requester_requirements.specific_format: Request must reasonably describe the records sought

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Each agency must designate a Records Access Officer
agency_obligations.electronic_submission_notes: Every agency with email capability must accept and respond to FOIL requests electronically
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Requestor may specify preferred format; electronic transmission preferred when possible
agency_obligations.liberal_construction: Law must be liberally construed to promote public access

oversight_body.name: Committee on Open Government
oversight_body.role: Provides guidance on FOIL compliance, issues advisory opinions, and assists with appeals
oversight_body.contact_info: Department of State, One Commerce Plaza, 99 Washington Avenue, Suite 650, Albany, NY 12231

primary_sources: New York Public Officers Law Article 6, §§84-90
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official New York statute and Committee on Open Government guidance. Initial response required within 5 business days (grant, deny, or acknowledge). If acknowledged, agency has additional 20 business days to respond (total max 25 business days). Standard copy fee is $0.25/page for documents up to 9"x14". Electronic submissions required if agency has email capability. Administrative appeal within 30 days of denial, with further appeal to Committee on Open Government or courts. Attorney fees recoverable if requestor substantially prevails.
